lines.text: Enter OTHELLO and IAGO

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Will you think so?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Think so, Iago!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: What, To kiss in private?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: An unauthorized kiss.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Or to be naked with her friend in bed An hour or more, not meaning any harm?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Naked in bed, Iago, and not mean harm! It is hypocrisy against the devil: They that mean virtuously, and yet do so, The devil their virtue tempts, and they tempt heaven.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: So they do nothing, 'tis a venial slip: But if I give my wife a handkerchief,--

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: What then?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Why, then, 'tis hers, my lord; and, being hers, She may, I think, bestow't on any man.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: She is protectress of her honour too: May she give that?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Her honour is an essence that's not seen; They have it very oft that have it not: But, for the handkerchief,--

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: By heaven, I would most gladly have forgot it. Thou said'st, it comes o'er my memory, As doth the raven o'er the infected house, Boding to all--he had my handkerchief.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Ay, what of that?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: That's not so good now.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: What, If I had said I had seen him do you wrong? Or heard him say,--as knaves be such abroad, Who having, by their own importunate suit, Or voluntary dotage of some mistress, Convinced or supplied them, cannot choose But they must blab--

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Hath he said any thing?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: He hath, my lord; but be you well assured, No more than he'll unswear.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: What hath he said?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: 'Faith, that he did--I know not what he did.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: What? what?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Lie--

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: With her?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: With her, on her; what you will.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Lie with her! lie on her! We say lie on her, when they belie her. Lie with her! that's fulsome. --Handkerchief--confessions--handkerchief!--To confess, and be hanged for his labour;--first, to be hanged, and then to confess.--I tremble at it. Nature would not invest herself in such shadowing passion without some instruction. It is not words that shake me thus. Pish! Noses, ears, and lips. --Is't possible?--Confess--handkerchief!--O devil!--
Falls in a trance

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Work on, My medicine, work! Thus credulous fools are caught; And many worthy and chaste dames even thus, All guiltless, meet reproach. What, ho! my lord! My lord, I say! Othello! How now, Cassio!
Enter CASSIO

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: What's the matter?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: My lord is fall'n into an epilepsy: This is his second fit; he had one yesterday.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Rub him about the temples.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: No, forbear; The lethargy must have his quiet course: If not, he foams at mouth and by and by Breaks out to savage madness. Look he stirs: Do you withdraw yourself a little while, He will recover straight: when he is gone, I would on great occasion speak with you. How is it, general? have you not hurt your head?
Exit CASSIO

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Dost thou mock me?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I mock you! no, by heaven. Would you would bear your fortune like a man!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: A horned man's a monster and a beast.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: There's many a beast then in a populous city, And many a civil monster.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Did he confess it?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Good sir, be a man; Think every bearded fellow that's but yoked May draw with you: there's millions now alive That nightly lie in those unproper beds Which they dare swear peculiar: your case is better. O, 'tis the spite of hell, the fiend's arch-mock, To lip a wanton in a secure couch, And to suppose her chaste! No, let me know; And knowing what I am, I know what she shall be.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O, thou art wise; 'tis certain.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Stand you awhile apart; Confine yourself but in a patient list. Whilst you were here o'erwhelmed with your grief-- A passion most unsuiting such a man-- Cassio came hither: I shifted him away, And laid good 'scuse upon your ecstasy, Bade him anon return and here speak with me; The which he promised. Do but encave yourself, And mark the fleers, the gibes, and notable scorns, That dwell in every region of his face; For I will make him tell the tale anew, Where, how, how oft, how long ago, and when He hath, and is again to cope your wife: I say, but mark his gesture. Marry, patience; Or I shall say you are all in all in spleen, And nothing of a man.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Dost thou hear, Iago? I will be found most cunning in my patience; But--dost thou hear?--most bloody.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: That's not amiss; But yet keep time in all. Will you withdraw? Now will I question Cassio of Bianca, A housewife that by selling her desires Buys herself bread and clothes: it is a creature That dotes on Cassio; as 'tis the strumpet's plague To beguile many and be beguiled by one: He, when he hears of her, cannot refrain From the excess of laughter. Here he comes: As he shall smile, Othello shall go mad; And his unbookish jealousy must construe Poor Cassio's smiles, gestures and light behavior, Quite in the wrong. How do you now, lieutenant?
OTHELLO retires
Re-enter CASSIO

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: The worser that you give me the addition Whose want even kills me.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Ply Desdemona well, and you are sure on't. Now, if this suit lay in Bianco's power, How quickly should you speed!
Speaking lower

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Alas, poor caitiff!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Look, how he laughs already!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I never knew woman love man so.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Alas, poor rogue! I think, i' faith, she loves me.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Now he denies it faintly, and laughs it out.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Do you hear, Cassio?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Now he importunes him To tell it o'er: go to; well said, well said.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: She gives it out that you shall marry hey: Do you intend it?

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Ha, ha, ha!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Do you triumph, Roman? do you triumph?

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: I marry her! what? a customer! Prithee, bear some charity to my wit: do not think it so unwholesome. Ha, ha, ha!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: So, so, so, so: they laugh that win.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: 'Faith, the cry goes that you shall marry her.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Prithee, say true.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I am a very villain else.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Have you scored me? Well.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: This is the monkey's own giving out: she is persuaded I will marry her, out of her own love and flattery, not out of my promise.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Iago beckons me; now he begins the story.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: She was here even now; she haunts me in every place. I was the other day talking on the sea-bank with certain Venetians; and thither comes the bauble, and, by this hand, she falls me thus about my neck--

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Crying 'O dear Cassio!' as it were: his gesture imports it.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: So hangs, and lolls, and weeps upon me; so hales, and pulls me: ha, ha, ha!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Now he tells how she plucked him to my chamber. O, I see that nose of yours, but not that dog I shall throw it to.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Well, I must leave her company.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Before me! look, where she comes.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: 'Tis such another fitchew! marry a perfumed one. What do you mean by this haunting of me?
Enter BIANCA

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: Let the devil and his dam haunt you! What did you mean by that same handkerchief you gave me even now? I was a fine fool to take it. I must take out the work?--A likely piece of work, that you should find it in your chamber, and not know who left it there! This is some minx's token, and I must take out the work? There; give it your hobby-horse: wheresoever you had it, I'll take out no work on't.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: How now, my sweet Bianca! how now! how now!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: By heaven, that should be my handkerchief!

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: An you'll come to supper to-night, you may; an you will not, come when you are next prepared for.
Exit

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: After her, after her.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: 'Faith, I must; she'll rail in the street else.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Will you sup there?

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: 'Faith, I intend so.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Well, I may chance to see you; for I would very fain speak with you.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Prithee, come; will you?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Go to; say no more.
Exit CASSIO

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: [Advancing]  How shall I murder him, Iago?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Did you perceive how he laughed at his vice?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O Iago!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: And did you see the handkerchief?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Was that mine?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Yours by this hand: and to see how he prizes the foolish woman your wife! she gave it him, and he hath given it his whore.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I would have him nine years a-killing. A fine woman! a fair woman! a sweet woman!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Nay, you must forget that.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay, let her rot, and perish, and be damned to-night; for she shall not live: no, my heart is turned to stone; I strike it, and it hurts my hand. O, the world hath not a sweeter creature: she might lie by an emperor's side and command him tasks.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Nay, that's not your way.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Hang her! I do but say what she is: so delicate with her needle: an admirable musician: O! she will sing the savageness out of a bear: of so high and plenteous wit and invention:--

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: She's the worse for all this.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O, a thousand thousand times: and then, of so gentle a condition!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Ay, too gentle.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Nay, that's certain: but yet the pity of it, Iago! O Iago, the pity of it, Iago!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: If you are so fond over her iniquity, give her patent to offend; for, if it touch not you, it comes near nobody.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I will chop her into messes: cuckold me!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: O, 'tis foul in her.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: With mine officer!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: That's fouler.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Get me some poison, Iago; this night: I'll not expostulate with her, lest her body and beauty unprovide my mind again: this night, Iago.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Do it not with poison, strangle her in her bed, even the bed she hath contaminated.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Good, good: the justice of it pleases: very good.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: And for Cassio, let me be his undertaker: you shall hear more by midnight.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Excellent good. What trumpet is that same?
A trumpet within

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Something from Venice, sure. 'Tis Lodovico Come from the duke: and, see, your wife is with him.
Enter LODOVICO, DESDEMONA, and Attendants

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Save you, worthy general!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: With all my heart, sir.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: The duke and senators of Venice greet you.
Gives him a letter

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I kiss the instrument of their pleasures.
Opens the letter, and reads

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: And what's the news, good cousin Lodovico?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I am very glad to see you, signior Welcome to Cyprus.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: I thank you. How does Lieutenant Cassio?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Lives, sir.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Cousin, there's fall'n between him and my lord An unkind breach: but you shall make all well.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Are you sure of that?

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: My lord?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: [Reads]  'This fail you not to do, as you will--'

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: He did not call; he's busy in the paper. Is there division 'twixt my lord and Cassio?

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: A most unhappy one: I would do much To atone them, for the love I bear to Cassio.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Fire and brimstone!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: My lord?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Are you wise?

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: What, is he angry?

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: May be the letter moved him; For, as I think, they do command him home, Deputing Cassio in his government.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Trust me, I am glad on't.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Indeed!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: My lord?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I am glad to see you mad.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Why, sweet Othello,--

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: [Striking her]  Devil!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: I have not deserved this.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: My lord, this would not be believed in Venice, Though I should swear I saw't: 'tis very much: Make her amends; she weeps.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O devil, devil! If that the earth could teem with woman's tears, Each drop she falls would prove a crocodile. Out of my sight!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: I will not stay to offend you.
Going

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Truly, an obedient lady: I do beseech your lordship, call her back.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Mistress!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: My lord?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: What would you with her, sir?

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Who, I, my lord?

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay; you did wish that I would make her turn: Sir, she can turn, and turn, and yet go on, And turn again; and she can weep, sir, weep; And she's obedient, as you say, obedient, Very obedient. Proceed you in your tears. Concerning this, sir,--O  well-painted passion!-- I am commanded home. Get you away; I'll send for you anon. Sir, I obey the mandate, And will return to Venice. Hence, avaunt! Cassio shall have my place. And, sir, tonight, I do entreat that we may sup together: You are welcome, sir, to Cyprus.--Goats and monkeys!
Exit DESDEMONA
Exit

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Is this the noble Moor whom our full senate Call all in all sufficient? Is this the nature Whom passion could not shake? whose solid virtue The shot of accident, nor dart of chance, Could neither graze nor pierce?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: He is much changed.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Are his wits safe? is he not light of brain?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: He's that he is: I may not breathe my censure What he might be: if what he might he is not, I would to heaven he were!

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: What, strike his wife!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: 'Faith, that was not so well; yet would I knew That stroke would prove the worst!

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Is it his use? Or did the letters work upon his blood, And new-create this fault?

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Alas, alas! It is not honesty in me to speak What I have seen and known. You shall observe him, And his own courses will denote him so That I may save my speech: do but go after, And mark how he continues.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: I am sorry that I am deceived in him.
Exeunt
